cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to track across the Leeward Islands then turn slightly northwest toward the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south-east of Puerto Rico (close to San Juan, PR)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Puerto Rico, Vieques, and Culebra (Hurricane Watch in effect)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Guadeloupe, Dominica, Martinique, St. Lucia, U.S. Virgin Islands, British Virgin Islands, St. Kitts/Nevis/Montserrat (Hurricane Warning area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands through the U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and portions of the Dominican Republic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) likely to arrive late Tuesday; hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible Wednesday with a 43% chance at San Juan.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 6–9 ft above normal tides along the north and east coasts of Puerto Rico, including San Juan Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals up to 25 inches could trigger life-threatening flash floods and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, dangerous rip currents, and possible debris flow that can hinder port operations and ground transportation.
